SENT.plain: A 40-year-old man was admitted with high fever and cough
Pneumonic shadows of the left middle and lower lung fields increased rapidly, and his blood gases worsened
Initial treatment with cefmenoxime, piperacillin, and minocycline was ineffective
Administration of rifampicin was started for suspected legionella pneumonia, but it did not control the spread of the pneumonia shadows
After addition of an antifungal agent and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole, his symptoms gradually improved
Isolation of Legionella pneumophila from sputum specimens collected on the 4th day of admission confirmed the diagnosis on day 10
The patient was then given oral rifampicin plus cefmenoxime to prevent mixed infection, and showed a satisfactory improvement
Legionella pneumonia developed secondary to compromise of the patient's immunity due to steroid therapy for MDS

After recovering from Legionella pneumonia, the patient subsequently developed tuberculous pleurisy and Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia, which were cured by antituberculous therapy and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole
However, acute hepatitis followed by hepatic failure developed, and he died on day 121 after admission
